intro: Listrostachys linearifolia, commonly known as the linearleaf sedge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, while its flowering structures are small and clustered in spikelets. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
